What I like most is how open everything feels. You can sneak around looting abandoned buildings, go full Rambo in the woods, build a base, hunt animals, or just run around trying not to starve (which, for me, happens way too often). The map is huge, and every time I think I‚Äôve seen most of it, I stumble into some new corner of the island and immediately get chased by something that wants me dead.

Combat is hit-or-miss depending on what you‚Äôre into. Speaking of puppets‚Äîthey‚Äôre creepy as hell when they sprint at you, but it definitely keeps things exciting.

The crafting and metabolism systems are super detailed, almost too detailed, but once you get the hang of it, it makes the survival feel way more realistic. Eating the wrong thing actually matters. So does running too much, or carrying too much, or basically doing anything without planning ahead.

The game isn‚Äôt perfect‚Äîthere are bugs, and sometimes it feels a little rough around the edges‚Äîbut when SCUM hits, it really hits. It‚Äôs one of those games where you can easily lose hours without realizing it.

Even though I haven‚Äôt spent hundreds of hours like some players, I‚Äôve seen enough to form an honest opinion ‚Äî and sadly, it‚Äôs disappointing for how long the game has been in Early Access.

‚úÖ PROS

Excellent Survival Systems
The metabolism and core survival mechanics are among the best I‚Äôve seen in any game. Vitamins, hydration, body temperature, energy ‚Äî it‚Äôs all there and genuinely impressive. This is clearly where SCUM shines and what it was built around.

Huge Open World with Potential
The map is massive, with a ton of room for exploration and base building. There‚Äôs potential for it to become one of the best survival adventure experiences‚Ä¶ someday.

Solid Framework for a True Sandbox
Custom server settings, admin controls, scripting options, and freedom to modify rules give this game a great sandbox foundation. Vehicles, boats, planes ‚Äî all modular and detailed.
The systems are incredible; the content is not.

‚ùå CONS

Janky Movement and Controls
Movement speed is tied to your mouse scroll wheel (why?). Interaction controls overlap in messy ways ‚Äî opening your inventory also opens the emote/pee/vomit wheel. Changing keybinds doesn‚Äôt fix it. These should be separate keys, not stacked together.

Base Building Needs a Complete Rework
Easily one of the weakest parts of SCUM. It‚Äôs clunky, unintuitive, and restrictive.

Segmented walls needing upgrades piece by piece.

Awkward snapping that barely aligns.

Random ‚Äúcan‚Äôt place here‚Äù errors.

And that cursed ‚ÄúHold F ‚Üí select upgrade ‚Üí confirm ‚Üí repeat‚Äù loop‚Ä¶ THIS FEELS REALLY CRAPPY.
You can‚Äôt properly extend or expand structures ‚Äî no balconies, no creative freedom.
Games like Rust, DayZ, and 7 Days to Die handle building way better.

Gear & Progression Feel Empty
Clothing and gear variety are painfully limited. A few recolors, a few guns, and then repetition.
After looting one bunker, you‚Äôve basically seen it all ‚Äî the sense of progression or discovery disappears fast.

Why Bunkers Feel Repetitive

Static loot tables. Almost every bunker shares the same loot pool ‚Äî guns, ammo, attachments. No unique bunker-only items.

No scaling. Loot barely changes with fame level, location, or difficulty. Once you‚Äôve looted one, you‚Äôve looted them all.

Event spawns slowed down. Special crates and rotating loot stopped being updated meaningfully after version 0.9.

Graphics Are Inconsistent
Decent in some areas, but low-quality textures still appear ‚Äî even on high-end GPUs like an RTX 4070.

Outposts Are a Cool Idea but Break Survival Balance
Being able to sell anything and buy all your gear instantly ruins the survival loop. There‚Äôs no sense of scarcity or progression.

Puppet (zombie) variety is minimal ‚Äî maybe three main models. Sounds are repetitive and lack impact. AI pathfinding and awareness feel outdated.

‚öôÔ∏è The Game‚Äôs Strengths (But Underused)

Even with its problems, SCUM‚Äôs foundation is one of the best ever made for survival games:

Deepest survival simulation in the genre (nutrition, injuries, diseases, metabolism).

True base-territory mechanics and modular construction.

Vehicles, boats, planes, and admin scripting systems.

üîÆ What‚Äôs Missing / Still in Progress

Players have been asking for years for:
